===Etymology===
{{unk.|lang=ja|sort=くわい}}. One theory suggests that this is an alteration from {{ja-l|川}}{{ja-l|芋}} (''kawa imo'', “river tuber”), but the old kana spelling of {{m|ja|くわゐ|tr=kuwawi}} for {{lang|ja|慈姑}} does not match the old kana spelling of {{m|ja|かはうも|tr=kafaumo}} for {{ja-l|川}}{{ja-l|芋}}. This is more likely a compound of {{m|ja|鍬|tr=kuwa||plow}}, from the shape of the leaves, plus an unknown element {{lang|ja|ゐ}} (''wi'').

The kanji are [[ateji]], borrowed from the {{etyl|zh|ja|sort=くわい}} name for this plant.
